content: I've been thinking a lot about assoc type normalization, type inference, the borrow checker, and other related issues and I think I'm starting to get somewhere.
I'm trying to decide the best way to convey these ideas :)
This is kind of exactly what "a-mir-formality" is for, I suppose :)
Anyway, just feeling excited! I think I'll try to do a write-up or some blog posts or something
I made this hackmd this morning https://hackmd.io/PDiz7QdHSD-pS0CD0yF_Tw but I realized that it has a lot of stuff to write up
still, my goal is to get something documented because I'd like to present about these in the workshop Apr 3
there's going to be a lot of smart people in that room so I'm trying to figure out the best thing to get feedback on =)
anyway, the idea is to integrate an (enhanced) version of the "algebraic subtyping" stuff
I realize that it may also solve the problem of inferring higher-ranked lifetimes in closures
which has always seemed intuitively possible with universes -- the "levels" mechanism described in that paper is basically exactly universes and goes right to this problem.

nikomatsakis said:

still, my goal is to get something documented because I'd like to present about these in the workshop Apr 3

which workshop? just curious, I think you've mentioned that you were giving a lecture or something in a conference, is it related?
